result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin J Klopstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.  DNA sample.  If defendant successfully complete probation, he may petition the court for expungement

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin J Klopstein

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM2063 and 15CM2064 called: 10:02am
State appears by ADA Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

Both parties request COURT adopt report that defendant is competent to proceed; COURT receives Dr. Galli's report and finds defendant competent to proceed in both cases.


PLEA:
15CM2063 - Ct. 1 (Poss Dangerous Weapon on School Grounds)>>NO CONTEST
15CM2064 - Ct. 1 (Misd Theft)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on both counts; 1 year Probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

>>If defendant successfully completes probation, he may petition COURT for expungement.

Adj: 10:10am

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM2063 and 15CM2064 called: 3:00pm
State appears by ADAC.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Attorney Suzanne O'Neill.  

Attorney O'Neill raises competency of defendant.
COURT orders outpatient examination to be completed - parties to set next court date in line with time frame for examination to be completed.
Atty O'Neill to draft order today.

Adj: 3:02pm
Includes 15CM2063 and 15CM2064.    Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.
